creator: frederic.bages@in-fusio.com
text:
The project is made of two build.xml files :
(1) myroot/build.xml
(2) myroot/examples/prj/build.xml

(1) call (2) with the following line :
<ant dir="examples/prj/" inheritAll="false"/>

(2) try to execute a command with :
    <exec executable="./remove-doctype" failonerror="yes">
      <arg value="*cut*"/>
      <arg value="*cut*"/>
    </exec>

The remove-doctype command is in the directory of (2).

------------- Tests :

If we execute (2) directly the exec task pass.
If we execute (1) which call (2) the exec task fail.

------------- Workaround :

To manage to call (1) we have to create a file called "remove-doctype"
in the directory of (1) and chmod it executable. This file can be empty.
(1) call (2) and (2) manage to exec the command "remove-doctype" in it's
own directory (2). The empty file is only a placebo.

------------- My understanding :

the exec task may check if the executable exists and is executable. This
check is bugged. When we use the workaround the exec task check pass and
the good executable is called (not the one checked). So it may be a bug 
in the check part of the exec task.

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
I think this is a duplicate of Bug 3129.

Can you please add vmlauncher="false" to your <exec> task and see whether it
works then?

creator: frederic.bages@in-fusio.com
text:
You are right, 

When I add vmlauncher="false" to my exec tasks and remove the
placebo files, the ant build works in eithier of the two cases 
( call (1) or (2) ).

I didn't see the bug #3129 as i only checked open bugs :-( Please
accept my excuses for this mistake.

Thank you for your help.
